ground_truth: She puts two hands lightly on his waist to move him out of the way, and he gulps at the contact, since no one else ever touches him, but covers his self-consciousness. She barks a mirthless though hearty laugh. If we could read Melvin, which we can't, we'd see him unsettled by the date talk. The two waitresses signal their protests as Melvin walks back into the restaurant proper, hanging near their table, and his discomfort builds in this limbo. The Woman starts to protest. There is in Carol's attitude toward Melvin some ingredient of self-satisfaction—that she is the only one in the place who can handle him. She starts to clear the table. Some crazy street-freak has slipped under her perfect guard and momentarily devastated her, and Melvin senses that he's gone way too far. A beat and then Melvin nods, hardly breathing, backing down. She walks away, and Melvin watches her, biting his lower lip. She is underneath a YOUNGER, cuter MAN on the living room sofa, each time startling herself with her own noise and trying to reign it in. The Young Man stops and looks at her, and pulling herself together, she goes off down the hallway. She takes off her headphones when she sees Carol, then hears the cough. Carol now goes into her son's room, which is a monument to horrible, sleepless nights, with two drugstore de-humidifying filters, a nebulizer (breathing contraption), a waste basket, a nightstand filled with medicine, a blood pressure kit, stacks of seven-year-old toys, and a small TV wedged into the tiny space. Carol feels his head, and then he coughs, trying to suppress it. She brings up a waste basket as he throws up and she comforts him. He apologizes. As she re-enters the living room, he is taking a cigarette from a pack, palms the cigarette, and resumes making out. His hand squeezes her breast, then he stops and looks at his hand. She looks down and sees a bit of throw-up he picked up while feeling her and then notices him looking at her with extreme distaste. She barks a laugh to cover her embarrassment but speaks the truth. Seeing the Hustlers, he leads the way back toward the studio, chatting away unaware that Vincent is disrobing as he follows him and eyeing the expensive apartment. He turns and sees the naked model as Vincent moves back to retrieve his clothes. Vincent is striking blatantly sexual poses to the increasingly uneasy Simon. Vincent has instinctively put Simon on the defensive, and Vincent's slack-jawed expression changes as he feels an intellectual tingle to be having this conversation. There's a joy in him at this moment—a bit of purity. Carol and LESLIE, another waitress, are waiting for their order at the cappuccino bar.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
She gently places both hands on his waist, intending to move him aside, and he gulps at the unexpected contact, feeling somewhat flustered, as he is unaccustomed to personal touch. Despite his discomfort, he makes an effort to hide his self-consciousness. She then lets out a laugh that is hearty in volume, yet lacking genuine amusement. If we were able to delve into Melvin's thoughts, which we are not, we would see him feeling quite unsettled by the talk of a date. As Melvin re-enters the main area of the bustling restaurant, the two waitresses express their discontent through visible signals, while Melvin awkwardly lingers near their table, caught in a state of increasing discomfort. The Woman begins to voice her objections. In Carol's demeanor towards Melvin, there exists an air of self-satisfaction—she is quite aware that she is the sole person in the establishment who has the ability to manage him effectively. She begins the task of clearing the table. Meanwhile, some erratic street character unexpectedly bypasses her normally impeccable defenses, causing a momentary upheaval, and Melvin perceives that he has crossed a line. After a pause, Melvin gives a slight nod, his breath nearly halted as he retreats. As she walks away, Melvin observes her closely, nervously biting his lower lip. 

Elsewhere, she finds herself underneath a YOUNGER, more attractive MAN on the living room sofa, repeatedly startling herself with her own noises and attempting to suppress them. The Young Man pauses and gazes at her, prompting her to compose herself before she heads off down the hallway. Upon spotting Carol, she removes her headphones, then catches the sound of a cough. Carol enters her son's room, which is practically a shrine to countless, torturous sleepless nights. It is packed with two drugstore de-humidifying filters, a nebulizer for breathing assistance, a wastebasket, a nightstand overflowing with medicine, a kit for checking blood pressure, piles of toys dating back seven years, and a small television crammed into the cramped space. Carol checks her child's forehead, and he coughs again, clearly trying hard to suppress it. She quickly retrieves a wastebasket as he vomits, comforting him throughout. He apologizes in his weakened voice. As she returns to the living room, he is in the act of taking a cigarette from its pack, discretely tucking it in his palm, and continues their previous intimate interaction. His hand, inappropriately, squeezes her breast before he stops and looks at his own hand in confusion. She glances down and notices some remnants of vomit that got transferred while he touched her, and then catches him staring at her with a look of pronounced distaste. She lets out a laugh to cover her embarrassment, yet it is a laugh filled with unvarnished truth. Observing the Hustlers, he guides the way back towards the studio, maintaining a lively conversation, unaware that Vincent is in the process of disrobing as he follows, all while taking in the sights of the lavish apartment. He turns around to see the nude model, just as Vincent moves back to retrieve his garments. Vincent strikes overtly sexual poses, making Simon more and more uneasy. Vincent has, by instinct, placed Simon on the defensive, while his initially slack-jawed expression shifts as he experiences an intellectual stimulation from the ongoing exchange. At this moment, a pure joy radiates from within him. Meanwhile, Carol and LESLIE, another waitress, stand waiting for their order at the cappuccino bar, engaged in idle conversation as they await their drinks.

High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Carol now goes into her son's room which is a monument to horrible sleepless nights with two drugstore dehumidifying filters a nebulizer breathing contraption a waste basket a nightstand filled with medicine a blood pressure kit stacks of sevenyearold toys and a small TV wedged into the tiny space. Carol feels his head and then he coughs trying to suppress it. She brings up a waste basket as he throws up and she comforts him. He apologizes. As she reenters the living room he is taking a cigarette from a pack palms the cigarette and resumes making out. His hand squeezes her breast then he stops and looks at his hand. She looks down and sees a bit of throwup he picked up while feeling her and then notices him looking at her with extreme distaste. She barks a laugh to cover her embarrassment but speaks the truth. Seeing the Hustlers he leads the way back toward the studio chatting away unaware that. Vincent is disrobing as he follows him and eyeing the expensive apartment. He turns and sees the naked model as Vincent moves back to retrieve his clothes. Vincent is striking blatantly sexual poses to the increasingly uneasy Simon. Vincent has instinctively put Simon on the defensive and Vincent's slackjawed expression changes as he feels an intellectual tingle to be having this conversation. There is a joy in him at this moment—a bit of purity. Carol and LESLIE another waitress are waiting for their order at the cappuccino bar.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She places two feet firmly on the gate to lift it out of the path, and it whistles at the breeze, since nobody ever sees it, but hides its uniqueness. He chirps a cheerful yet silent giggle. If we could interpret Marvin, which we can't, we'd find him soothed by the weather chat. The two janitors wave their agreements as Marvin skips back into the garden shed, hovering near their swing, and his excitement swells in this haven. The Bird begins to agree. There is in Lucy's demeanor toward Marvin an element of curiosity—that she is the only one in the group who can puzzle him. She begins to tidy the room. Some sneaky alley-cat has tiptoed past her sturdy gate and momentarily puzzled her, and Marvin senses that he's ventured way too close. A pause, and then Marvin shrugs, barely blinking, backing away. He dances around, and Marvin observes him, chewing his top hat. He is above a YOUNGER, smarter OWL on the bedroom rug, each time shocking himself with his own silence and trying to amplify it. The Young Owl turns and stares at him, and gathering himself together, he wanders off down the staircase. He removes his glasses when he spots Lucy, then hears the sneeze. Lucy now enters her neighbor's den, which is a tribute to peaceful, dreamy nights, with two grocery-store humidifying fans, an air purifier (breathing contraption), a trash bin, a bookshelf filled with novels, a heart rate monitor, stacks of fifteen-year-old books, and a tiny radio squeezed into the narrow corner. Lucy pats its back, and then it sneezes, trying to stifle it. She picks up a trash bin as it sneezes again and she soothes it. It apologizes. As she exits the den, it is lighting a candle from a box, hides the candle, and resumes singing. Its paw pats her shoulder, then it pauses and examines its paw. He peers down and discovers a splash of rain he caught while patting her and then notices it staring at her with utter surprise. He chirps a giggle to hide his delight but tells the lie. Noticing the Artists, it leads the path back toward the library, humming away oblivious to Leonard arranging as he follows it and admiring the rustic cabin. He spins and notices the dressed statue as Leonard strides back to claim his jacket. Leonard is crafting awkwardly elegant gestures to the increasingly relaxed Max. Leonard has naturally put Max on the offensive, and Leonard’s wide-eyed gaze shifts as he experiences a physical shiver to be having this dialogue. There’s a calm in her at this point—a touch of clarity. Lucy and OLIVER, another janitor, are lingering for their delivery at the espresso stand.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A woman lightly pushes him by the waist, causing him unease since he's unaccustomed to touch, but he hides his discomfort. She laughs mirthlessly, and if we could read Melvin's mind, his discomfort with date talk would be clear. Two waitresses express disapproval as Melvin loiters near their table, and Carol feels a sense of self-satisfaction as she's the only one who can manage him. After a tense exchange, Melvin backs down. Carol, meanwhile, experiences a personal moment under a younger man but pulls herself together. She visits her son in a room cluttered with medical equipment, comforts him after he vomits, and later returns to find the young man resuming their previous intimacy, oblivious to the incident. Vincent, at the studio, is seen posing provocatively, catching Simon off-guard, but Simon finds an intellectual thrill in their interaction. Back at the cappuccino bar, Carol and another waitress, Leslie, wait for their order.
